content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Find the latest article regarding the economic implications of climate change in Europe as reported by BBC News and summarize the central points.  Please interact with https://www.bbc.com/news/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To find the latest article about the economic implications of climate change in Europe, it would be efficient to go directly to the Europe section, since this will help focus on relevant regional news. The menu for "Europe" is labeled as [23].
Action: Click [23]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: I am on the Europe news section. To find the latest article on the economic implications of climate change, I need to look for article headlines or summaries related to economics and climate change. The currently visible articles do not mention climate change or economic topics in their headlines. I need to scroll down to reveal more articles and find one that matches the required topic.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The articles currently visible focus on military, cultural, humanitarian, or social topics in Europe, but none mention climate change or economic impacts. I need to scroll further to find articles related to the economic implications of climate change in Europe.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.35
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The section currently visible contains an advertisement and part of the articles previously seen. No articles about climate change or its economic effects are visible. I need to scroll further to find the appropriate article.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: None of the current article headlines mention climate change or economic impacts in Europe. There is a "Features & Analysis" section opening just below; this often contains in-depth articles and may include relevant climate or economics coverage.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Features & Analysis" section is visible, but the article headlines shown do not mention climate change or economic implications in Europe. The visible "Watch/Listen" section may not be as relevant, but more written articles could be below. Scrolling down further could reveal additional articles that match the topic.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The articles in the current view still do not mention climate change or economic implications for Europe. The "Fuelling the Future" segment below appears to be an advertisement, not an editorial article. I should continue scrolling down to search for relevant news content.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The "Latest Updates" section is visible, but the articles listed do not mention climate change or economic implications in Europe. To find the latest relevant article, I should continue scrolling for more news items.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The articles currently visible focus on migrant returns, a Neo-Nazi leader's release, and NATO's response to Russian drone incursions—none are related to the economic implications of climate change in Europe. Further scrolling is needed to potentially locate relevant news.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.65
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The visible part mostly shows an advertisement and a partial article headline that starts "Prince Harry makes surprise Ukraine visit..." which is not related to climate change or economics. None of the content is related to the economic implications of climate change in Europe, so I should continue scrolling.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The articles currently in view concern Prince Harry's Ukraine visit, nuns returning to a convent, and Albania's AI minister. None discuss climate change or its economic implications in Europe. Further scrolling is required to find a relevant article.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.75
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The articles shown are about Albania's AI minister, the war in Ukraine, and a tribute to a sportswoman. None address climate change or economic implications in Europe. More scrolling is needed to locate a relevant article.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.95

Observation: please analyze the attached screenshot and give the Thought and Action. I've provided the tag name of each element and the text it contains (if text exists). Note that <textarea> or <input> may be textbox, but not exactly. Please focus more on the screenshot and then refer to the textual information.
[0]: <button> "Open menu";	[1]: "British Broadcasting Corporation";	[2]: "Register";	[3]: "Sign In";	[4]: "1";	[5]: "2";	[6]: "3";	[7]: "4";	[8]: "5";	[9]: "...";	[10]: "12";	[12]: "British Broadcasting Corporation";	[13]: "Home";	[14]: "News";	[15]: "Sport";	[16]: "Business";	[17]: "Innovation";	[18]: "Culture";	[19]: "Arts";	[20]: "Travel";	[21]: "Earth";	[22]: "Audio";	[23]: "Video";	[24]: "Live";	[25]: "Weather";	[26]: "BBC Shop";	[27]: "BritBox";	[28]: <button> "BBC in other languages";

content:
Thought: I have reached the end of the current list of articles for this section. The available articles do not cover the economic implications of climate change in Europe. I now see top-level menu options; navigating to "Earth" may lead to more climate-related news, or "Business" for economic analysis. Combining both topics, "Earth" is most likely to cover climate change.
Action: Click [21]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.85
